key_title: Key to the species of Sedum

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Crassulaceae

source.author: Toelken, H.R.; Jeanes, J.A.; Stajsic, V.
source.title: Crassulaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Toelken, H.R.; Jeanes, J.A.; Stajsic, V. (1996). Crassulaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves dorsiventrally flattened, oblong-elliptic to spathulate, 15–25 mm wide; inflorescence a terminal panicle to 20 cm long
Leaves terete or subterete, shape not as above, less than 10 mm wide; inflorescence a terminal cyme to c. 6 cm long
Plants herbaceous, leaves less than 6 mm long
Stems somewhat woody, leaves usually more than 6 mm long
Stems procumbent or ascending, 5–25 cm long, yellow-green; petals bright yellow, 6–8 mm long; stamens 10; plant perennial
Stems erect, 2–5 cm long, reddish; petals white or pale pink, c. 3 mm long; stamens 4–5; plant annual
Leaves subterete with the upper surface slightly flattened, apex acute or obtuse, if ever somewhat cylindric then leaves less than 12 mm long
Matt-forming subshrubs; leaves up to 10 mm long, apex obtuse; flowers less than 5 mm diam.
Leaves usually more than 10 mm long, apex acute; flowers more than 5 mm diam.
